history.text: Hello. Let's talk about the movie Zootopia.
yeah
what is the plot of the movie
its a 3d animated movie i think so
It's about a bunny named Judy Hopps who becomes a police officer despite stereotypes against her kind (prey animal).
It was directed by Byron Howard and Rich Moore
right
The movie has an anti-stereotype message, and it's apparently pretty clever in delivering it by using animal species instead of race.
It has a 98% on Rotten Tomatoes too, that's pretty good
yeah your right
After determining Nick was a suspect seen in Otterton's last known sighting, Judy blackmails him into assisting her by covertly recording his confession to tax evasion with her carrot pen.

I remember that part
. It's basically a buddy cop comedy/adventure. It's pretty funny and thought-provoking in general
yes it was
They discover Manchas was captured by wolves, who Judy surmises are the "night howlers".
it was best scene in that movie
Haha yeah.
yes absolutely
actually the voice of all characters potrayed in the movie was awesome
who scored a music in this film?
it was really mind blowing especially the background score was awesome
Honestly, I am not sure.
yeah thats your point of vies i agree that
yeah thats your point of view i agree that
I do think it had great animation

yes your right comparing to other movies like fire breather this 
was little less in animation
True. I remember when Judy felt guilty for thinking that the savage behavior going around was caused by biological factors, and she ended up causing tension between her and Nick so she quit her job.
It was a nice portrayal of prejudice/stereotyping
yes absolutely ha ha
ofcourse yes it was

and also j
udy, praised for solving the case, has become friends with Nick and asks him to join the ZPD as her partner
I loved that part. Their friendship was the cutest part of the movie for me.
always friendship was the cutest thing right!!!

Yup! I also found it kind of funny that what caused the savage behavior in the animals was literally a drug developed from a plant (night howlers)
. It was kind of social commentary in a way.

yeah and also 
Judy and Nick obtain the serum as evidence, but before they can reach the ZPD, Bellwether confronts them in the Natural History Museum and takes the evidence, revealing herself as the mastermind behind a prey-supremacist conspiracy.
I was actually genuinely surprised that Bellwether was the villain.
samething happened to me even me also think like that
Right. I was glad that she was arrested at the end

ya it was a good end
 to a movie

uid1response.feedback: This was interesting. We had a decent chat about the film.

uid2response.feedback: it was very nice to chat with some person about movie and exploring about a plot of the movie and a very good experience, thank you
